::Killfest/EndBringer/Greven::

Killfest looks up as Dark Wolf flies into the air, two signature 
seeking missiles firing from Killfest's missile launcher, both 
heading for Dark Wolf, along with three shots from his EMP gun.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
EndBringer aims his guns up, firing two missiles from each launcher 
up at Dark Wolf, a total of four signature seeking missiles flying 
out toward the bot.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Greven immitates EndBringer, also firing four signature seeking 
missiles up at Dark Wolf.




--- In nbwrpg@y..., KSLawdogg@c... wrote:
> (Yan explained his EMP weapon better so I'll add in damage it 
caused here)
> 
> Dark Wolf/The Protectobots/Shockwave:
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Demon Wulf pushed himself to his feet painfully, but he was 
determined not to 
> beaten by a pack of the weakest Cybertronians on the planet, and 
his will was 
> stronger than his body.  He felt a searing pain in his chest and he 
let out a 
> slight growl.  The EMP blast had nearly struck his spark, and 
hitting some 
> power circuitry, draining him of needed energy.  There was only one 
way he 
> would be able to escape this battle without being defeated.
> 
> He looked to the damaged Streetwise and gave a sadistic grin 
showing off all 
> the needle point teeth in his muzzle.  "You, will die." he said, 
leaping into 
> the air glowing a bright green.
> 
> ---
> 
> Flesh Ripper fired off two fire balls at incoming missiles, rolling 
to the 
> left of one but the explosion of the other sending shrapnel into 
his face.  A 
> jagged piece of metal pierced into his snout and the Vok let out a 
> glass-breaking screech of pain.  He would've charged the enemy, but 
he saw 
> Demon Wulf and knew what was to come.  He leapt into the air with 
surprising 
> agility.
> 
> ---
> 
> Dark Claw saw inbound missiles and EMP blasts, he jumped to the 
left, 
> avoiding the EMP blasts but both missiles struck him while still in 
the air 
> and sent him slamming to his back.  The impact shook Dark Claw's 
insides, but 
> he got up quickly and ignored the gaping hole in his sternum, only 
a few 
> layers of light armor keeping his spark safe.
> 
> His red optics drifted to Demon Wulf and Flesh Ripper, and he 
smiled, leaping 
> into the air and started to glow green, ready to merge with his 
brethren.
> 
> ---
> 
> The three robots did not merge like Cybertronians.  Instead they 
slammed into 
> each other and seemed to mold into the shape of a twenty-five foot 
robot that 
> crashed to the ground.  The Vok gestalt was short, most gestalts a 
little 
> less than twice his size.  But he was still stronger than three 
weakened 
> robots seperated.  United, they were stronger and would provide 
enough 
> protection to escape.
> 
> Making a run that barely shook the earth when a padded and clawed 
foot hit 
> the ground, Dark Wolf the Vok gestalt leapt into the air, taking 
flight and 
> gaining altitude faster than larger and bulkier gestalts would.  
> 
> ---
> 
> Shockwave had gained enough altitude and was speeding through the 
air when he 
> saw something that was strange to him.  It appeared to be a hostage 
situation 
> by a robot he had seen before.  Menasor.  The Stunticon gestalt 
created by 
> Megatron himself to help give Decepticons supremacy on the ground.  
Which 
> worked, except for the wretched Aerialbots who defeated them.
> 
> The ancient robot wasn't at all interested in this look alike.  
Predacons had 
> made duplicates of ancient Decepticons, for all Shockwave knew was 
that this 
> was just another duplicate.
> 
> But, more interesting, was the exposed back of Element the newly 
arrived 
> Maximal gestalt who had already became a thorn in Shockwave's side 
by aiding 
> the Maximals with its new ship.  
> 
> "Prepare to fall, Maximal gestalt, to Shockwave, Emperor of the Neo 
> Decepticon Empire!" he sent on all Maximal comm. frequencies.  He 
armed the 
> dual missile tubes in his space fighter mode, and quickly got a 
target lock 
> on the middle of Element's back, not that it would be hard.
> 
> From both missile tubes launched a single energy-signature seeking 
missile, 
> screeching off at Element.
> 
> ---
> 
> Hot Spot climbed onto Blades, and the hatch opened, allowing the 
Protectobots 
> leader to sit in the cockpit of the Apache.  Harnessing himself in, 
Hot Spot 
> sighed in relief.  Being inside a heavily armed war machine felt 
nice.
> 
> "Alright...go after that get that's shooting that new robot." the 
team leader 
> ordered.
> 
> "Not a wise choice.  He's a space fighter.  They go faster than a 
chopper.  
> But I think we can lay some beatings down on that smaller gestalt 
that just 
> formed."
> 
> Hot Spot didn't need to think it over.  "Alright, launch missiles 
at the 
> Alliance gestalt, and I don't care how you feel about long-range 
weapons, 
> just do it.  We need all the edge we can get."
> 
> Blades didn't argue and armed two missiles, launching them off for 
the right 
> side of Dark Wolf.
> 
> ---
> 
> Groove watched Shockwave take of and lowered his weapon, watching a 
newly 
> formed gestalt and shrugged.  "It just never ends around here..." 
he 
> commented as he raised his pistol and fired off three photon bolts 
off at the 
> escaping gestalt.  It may not do much, but it was all he had.
> 
> ---
> 
> First Aid made an expression similar to a frown and watched the 
gestalt 
> getting away.  He mos definately had no weapons that would get 
through the 
> armor.  After all, he was a doctor, not a warrior, and he was glad 
the 
> fighting was over.
> 
> He transformed to his ambulance mode and drove off after Shockwave 
though.  
> Where there's an idiot with weapons there's somebody in pain, and 
First Aid 
> might finally live up to his name instead of being beaten down like 
a little 
> school boy.
> 
> ---
> 
> Streetwise almost fell down, the only thought he could get was the 
image of 
> Demon Wulf, and tha sadistic smile.  He watched First Aid drive by, 
almost 
> hitting him.  He just stood there, leaking mech-fluid down into 
some burnt 
> grass.  His optics scanned the ground and he saw the result of war, 
the 
> destruction.  A once beautiful landscape was now pretty much in 
ruins.  And 
> for what?  What had Maximals ever done to those who were attacking 
them?  All 
> the Maximals wanted to do was live in peace, but that didn't seem a 
good 
> solution for their enemies.  All the pain and suffering.  
> 
> New energy seemed to fill Streetwise and his grip on his photon 
pistol 
> tigthened.  He ran off after his ambulance ally, the pain still 
with him but 
> his senses seemed to be dulled as if someone had given him a drug.  
In his 
> free left hand a large heavy laser rifle formed from the depths of 
subspace.  
> In mid run the sudden new weight nearly tipped him over, but he was 
able to 
> balance out and continued his slow run.
